fields.description: Umbrella issue to cover GPU buffer memory management, IPC loading, mixed-device schema/record batch management, etc.

comments.body:
For starter, it will be great if there is a arrow serializer and deserializer that minimize host<->device transfer.  Initially, arrow needs to handle device memory pointer only and it doesn't need to deal with device IPC handles.   The schema is usually small that it is okay to be processed on the host side.  For the recordbatches, it is best to keep the payload on the device.  

EDIT: 
Adding a reference to gpu arrow deserializer implementation in libgdf: https://github.com/gpuopenanalytics/libgdf/blob/master/src/ipc.cu
Thanks. I opened ARROW-1364 about this.

Hi Arrow Team

Can you please let me know how can I get started with GPU support development for the Arrow?

Sorry If I'm being blunt as earlier I tried contacting via email, unfortunately, there was no response.Also, please let me know if this is a doable project for the beginner otherwise kindly point me to the different issue I can work upon.

If you have prior experience with GPU / CUDA development (and C++ development generally), then I would say it accessible since this is somewhat more to do with GPUs than it is about core Arrow development. As a way to get started (separate from GPU-related development), I might suggest picking up an issue or two to learn more about the existing Arrow codebases and memory / data model. 

I have no prior record of e-mails from you, are you subscribed to dev@arrow.apache.org? Thanks
This was resolved to sufficient satisfaction by Arrow 0.12. Further work can happen as it is needed
